definition: to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
to talk nonsense/to behave like a fool

sentences.english: This is where Bo Ya played his Qin.
sentences.chinese: 这里是伯牙弹琴的地方。

sentences.english: You are just casting pearls before swine.
Praise the LORD with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.
sentences.chinese: 你们应当弹琴称谢耶和华，用十弦瑟歌颂他。

sentences.english: But now bring me a harpist.
sentences.chinese: 现在你们给我找一个弹琴的来。

sentences.english: He was prophesying in his house, while David was playing the harp, as he usually did. Saul had a spear in his hand
sentences.chinese: 大卫照常弹琴，扫罗手里拿着枪。

sentences.english: Saul had his spear in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 大卫照常弹琴，扫罗手里拿著枪。

sentences.english: If you didn't read it, I'm talking to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没看它，那我就成对牛弹琴了。

sentences.english: I often hear the girl play the piano in the next room.
sentences.chinese: 我经常听到那个女孩在隔壁弹琴。

sentences.english: The wonderful gerben in the street begging, but beggars head drive.
sentences.chinese: 妙戈在街上弹琴乞讨，却被乞丐头头驱赶。

sentences.english: How long has he played the piano? For two hours .
sentences.chinese: 他弹琴弹了多久了，两个小时了。

sentences.english: When David was invited to King Saul's court, he soothed the king's nerves by playing on his lyre.
sentences.chinese: 大卫应邀进入扫罗王的宫廷，弹琴舒缓王的情绪。

sentences.english: You mean, what do I do when I am not at the piano?
sentences.chinese: 你是指我不弹琴的时候都做些什么吗？

sentences.english: Your advice is chucked away on that boy.
sentences.chinese: 你的劝告对那个男孩来说是对牛弹琴。

sentences.english: She had to make up her income as a pianist by teaching piano students.
sentences.chinese: 她这个钢琴家的收入得靠教人弹琴来添补。

sentences.english: Actually my first job was playing for dance classes in a dance academy!
sentences.chinese: 我的第一份工作是在舞蹈学院的舞蹈课上弹琴。

sentences.english: He plays the piano only because it amuses him.
sentences.chinese: 他弹钢琴只是因为弹琴给他带来乐趣。

definition: to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
to perform on a musical instrument
